channel.title: Compiling doesnt work win7
channel.description:
ok iv just got a new computer which is win7 i had windows xp and vista i can set my environmental paths iv set them for my new computer and typing "javac" and "java" works but i just cant compile it says this ...
The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue . . .
anybody help me from teamviewer or something?

item.title: Compiling doesnt work win7
item.dc:creator: @Merlen321 Merlen321
item.description:
@Merlen321 wrote:

I’ve had this problem too. If you have the Mod Tahorks or whatever compiler, I’ve heard it doesnt work. Try just searching others on google. But WHAT YOU NEED TO DO;

  1. Download JDK 6.

  2. Check to make sure it is downloaded correctly. To check for Windows 7, go to start. On the right hand side select “Computer” go to “OS” now find “Program Files” Now find “Java” open it. It should say somthing along the lines of this; jdk-6u24-windows-x64

  3. So if you were to put this into the compiler, It would be 1.6.0_24
    The _24 is the UPDATE. Chances are you will have a different one, so replace the 24 with your version. (If you need help finding your update, repeat step 2)

  4. If you have your Env. Variables set, It SHOULD work.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling doesnt work win7
item.dc:creator: @Woopzpkedu Woopzpkedu
item.description:
@Woopzpkedu wrote:

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic
